titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Host et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Order. Pursuant to Rule 48(a) of Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure and by leave of Court, the United States Attorney for the Northern District of Ohio dismisses the indictment as to Christina Yudith Gastelum Lopez, re 8 Indictment, 108 Motion to Dismiss filed by United States of America. Signed by Judge Christopher A. Boyko on 01/16/08. (M,M)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Host et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Judgment as to Adolfo Barragan-Rodriguez (2), Count(s) 1. Defendant sentenced to the Bureau of Prisons for 52 months followed by 3 years supervised release. Defendant's fine waived. Special assessment of $100 due immediately and payable to Clerk, U.S. District Court. Defendant remanded to the custody of the U.S. Marshal. Signed by Judge Christopher A. Boyko on 04/21/08. (M,M)

Defendant's fine waived. Special Assessment of $100 due immediately and payable to Clerk, US District Court. Defendant to self surrender to the Bureau of Prisons upon notification by United States Marshal. Judge Christopher A. Boyko on 07/10/08. (M,M)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Host et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Judgment as to Patricia Knepp (13), Count(s). Defendant sentenced to 3 years Probation. Defendant is sentenced to 6 months Home Confinement with Electronic Monitoring to commence no later than 30 days from the date of sentencing. The Defendant is given permission to work, attend religious services, medical appointments. Defendant shall pay the cost of Electronic Monitoring. Defendant's fine waived.v Special Assessment of $100 due immediately and payable to Clerk, U.S. District Court. Defendant shall undergo random drug tests. Upon motion by the Government, Counts 9, 24, 38, 51, 53, 55 are dismissed.. Judge Christopher A. Boyko on 07/10/08. (M,M)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Host et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Judgment as to David Knepp (12), Count(s). Defendant sentenced to the Bureau of Prisons for a term of 30 months followed by 3 years supervised release. Defendant's fine waived. Defendant shall pay a special assessment of $100 due immediately and payable to Clerk, U.S. District Court. Defendant shall voluntarily surrender to the Bureau of Prisons upon notification by the United States Marshal. Defendant's bond continued. Upon motion of the Government, the Court dismisses counts 16, 25, and 48 of the indictment as to David Knepp. Judge Christopher A. Boyko on 07/10/08. (M,M)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Host et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Judgment as to Dennis Grimes (9), Count(s) 1. Defendant sentenced to the Bureau of Prisons for a term of 9 months followed by 3 years supervised release. Defendant's fine waived. Special assessment of $100 due immediately and payable to Clerk, US District Court. Upon motion of the Government, the Court dismisses counts 19, 21, 27 and 50 of the indictment as to Dennis Grimes. Defendant shall voluntarily surrender to the Bureau of Prisons upon notification by the United States Marshal. Judge Christopher A. Boyko on 07/10/08. (M,M)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Host et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Judgment as to Meredith L. Rufener (16), Count(s) 1. Defendant sentenced to 3 years Probation. Defendant's fine waived. Defendant is subject to random drug/alcohol tests. Defendant shall participate in out/inpatient or detoxification substance abuse treatment. The Defendant shall participate in an outpatient mental health treatment program as directed by the probation officer. The Defendant shall cooperate in the collection of DNA as directed by the probation officer. The Defendant shall forfeit to the United States any and all property constituting, or derived from, any proceeds he obtained, directly or indirectly, as the result of the instant offense; and any and all of her property used or intended to be used, in any manner or part, to commit or to facilitate the commission of the instant offense. Judge Christopher A. Boyko on 07/17/08. (M,M)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 5:07-cr-00517; United States of America v. Host et al;

The Defendant shall participate in an outpatient mental health treatment program as directed by the probation officer. The Defendant shall cooperate in the collection of DNA as directed by the probation officer. The Defendant shall forfeit to the United States any and all property constituting, or derived from, any proceeds he obtained, directly or indirectly, as the result of the instant offense; and any and all of her property used or intended to be used, in any manner or part, to commit or to facilitate the commission of the instant offense. Judge Christopher A. Boyko on 07/17/08. (M,M)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Host et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Order. Defendant Candelaria Gastelum De Iribe is removable from the United States under 8 U.S.C. 1227(a)(2)(A)(iii) of the Immigration and Nationality Act, in that after entry, defendant was convicted of an aggravated felony, as defined in 8 U.S.C. 1101(a)(43)(B). Further ordered, pursuant to 8 U.S.C. 1228(c), that the defendant be removed from the United States so that promptly upon her release from confinement, the Department of Homeland Security, Immigration and Customs Enforcement, may execute said removal order according to applicable laws and regulations as to Candelaria Gastelum De Iribe, Related document 237 Judgment.. Judge Christopher A. Boyko on 07/24/08. (M,M)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 5:07-cr-00517; United States of America v. Host et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Northern District of Ohio
extension.docketText: Order. Defendant Candelaria Gastelum De Iribe is removable from the United States under 8 U.S.C. 1227(a)(2)(A)(iii) of the Immigration and Nationality Act, in that after entry, defendant was convicted of an aggravated felony, as defined in 8 U.S.C. 1101(a)(43)(B). Further ordered, pursuant to 8 U.S.C. 1228(c), that the defendant be removed from the United States so that promptly upon her release from confinement, the Department of Homeland Security, Immigration and Customs Enforcement, may execute said removal order according to applicable laws and regulations as to Candelaria Gastelum De Iribe, Related document 237 Judgment.. Judge Christopher A. Boyko on 07/24/08. (M,M)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Host et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Amended Judgment to Reflect Clerical Change as to Joseph Paul Host (1). Count(s) 1, 2, 3-6, 7, 8, 9-23, dismissed superseding indictment; Count(s) 1s, Defendant sentenced to the Bureau of Prisons for a termof 168 months followed by 3 years supervised release. Defendant's fine waived. Special Assessment of $100 due immediately and payable to Clerk. U.S. District Court. Defendant remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal.; Count(s) 2s, 3s-6s, dismissed upon motion of United States; Count(s) 7s, 8s, 9s-64s, dismissed upon motion of the United States. Judge Christopher A. Boyko on 08/08/08. (M,M)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Host et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Judgment as to Lawrence Welling (10), Count(s) 1. All counsel and probation officer present. Defendant sentenced to the Bureau of Prisons for 40 months followed by 3 years Supervised Release. Defendant's fine waived. Defendant shall pay Special Assessment of $100 due immediately and payable to Clerk, U.S. District Court. Boyko on 10/08/08. (M,M)
